column1: súlë (older thúlë or þúlë) is a noun meaning "spirit" in Quenya.
Image: Thule.gifSúlë is also the name in Quenya of the ninth letter of the Tengwar alphabet.  It is the first letter of the third grade or Tyellë
column2: which contains "voiceless spirants" and it is the third letter in the dental or t-series of consonants
column3: the Tincotéma.  In all modes except for later Quenya
column4: Súlë represents TH.  The Westron name for this letter is Thó.See Westron Tengwar

column1: The original name of Súlë was þúlë and in Quenya it had the value TH or þ. The alteration of its value occurred among the Noldor while in Valinor.  The change angered Fëanor for he felt it was an insult to change the pronunciation of the Mother-name of his mother Míriel
column2: which was þerindë.For more about this politicized linguistic debate
column3: see The Shibboleth of Fëanor#The case of the Quenya change of þ > s.  However
column4: the mutation of þ to S continued and eventually this letter was renamed Súlë and in Quenya only has the value S (and is only used instead of letters 29 or 30 when the original sound in a word was "þ").

column1: The word derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarme THŪ.
